(46) 1.)20th February, 1946.CABINET.FOREIGN LABOUR COMMITTEE.Note by the Secretary of the Cabinet.IN accordance with the Cabinet's decision of the 14th February (CM. (46)loth Conclusions, Minute 8) the Prime Minister has appointed a Committee ofMinisters with the following terms of reference : *" To examine, in the light cf the existing man-power shortage, thepossibility of making increased use of foreign labour, particularly in essential industries which are now finding special difficulty in recruiting labour."2. The composition of the Committee is as follows : Lord Privy Seal (Chairman). AHome Secretary.Secretary of State for Scotland.Minister of Labour.Minister of Agriculture and Fisheries.Minister of Fuel and Power.Minister of Health.Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs(Mr. McNeil).Parliamentary Secretary to the Board of Trade (Mr. Belcher).3. Mr. J. A. Drew, Cabinet Office, will act as Secretary of the Committee.(Signed) E. E. BRIDGES. *Cabinet Office, S. W. 1,20th February, 1946.[31339]
